heliolib.feature_engineering_service package

Submodules

heliolib.feature_engineering_service.expected_parameters_generator module

class heliolib.feature_engineering_service.expected_parameters_generator.ExpectedParametersGenerator(meteo_data, array_info, system_age, irradiance_key='G')[source]

Bases: object

BASELINE_IRRADIANCE_NOCT = 800
BASELINE_IRRADIANCE_STC = 1000
KEYS_TO_BE_VALIDATED = ['impp_noct', 'number_of_strings', 'wattage_noct', 'modules_per_string', 'i_mpp', 'panel_wattage', 'degrdn_yr1', 'degrdn_yr2']

A class to generate expected parameters for solar panels under NOCT and STC conditions.

Parameters:

meteo_datapandas.DataFrame

Meteorological data with multi-index columns.

array_infopandas.Series

Information about the solar array, including parameters like ‘i_mpp’, ‘v_mpp’, ‘wattage’, ‘impp_noct’, ‘vmpp_noct’, ‘wattage_noct’, ‘degrdn_yr1’, ‘degrdn_yr2’.

Irradiance_keyString

Irradiance values from meteorological data.

system_agefloat

it is the age of the plant from the day it was installed.

Methods:

generate_expected_features()

It generates the expected parameters under noct and stc conditions by calling the internal functions of this class.

Returns:

combined_expected_params : pandas.DataFrame The calculated expected parameters under NOCT and STC conditions of all inputs for a particular plant which have hierarchical columns of input.

ag_level_2 ag_level_1 curve datetime

341 1090

I_exp_stc

…

343

1099

P_exp_noct_degradation

2023-12-10 00:00:00 | 0.003378 | … | 0.0 2023-12-10 00:05:00 | 0.004176 | … | 0.0 2023-12-10 00:10:00 | 0.004403 | … | 0.0 2023-12-10 00:15:00 | 0.003948 | … | 0.0 2023-12-10 00:20:00 | 0.004176 | … | 0.0

Note:- * Corrected expected voltage and current is not in a scope for current version because we don’t have a surety of the reflection factor of the panel’s glass. * The returned(output) dataframe have indexes same as the meteo_data.

Example:

Object_ExpectedParametersGenerator = ExpectedParametersGenerator(meteo_data,

array_info, system_age, irradiance_key=’G’)

expected_parameters = Object_ExpectedParametersGenerator.generate_expected_features()

SYSTEM_AGE_TO_BE_OLDER = 1
generate_expected_features(under_which_condition: str | None = None)[source]

Generate expected features (current, voltage, power) based on NOCT and STC conditions including degradation correction on NOCT power.

Parameters:

under_which_condition: String It can only have two values first one if NOCT and second one ‘STC’, and if you will not provide any string to it will direct the code to return both the condition expected parameters.

Returns:

combined_expected_params : pandas.DataFrame The calculated expected parameters under NOCT and STC conditions of all inputs for a particular plant which have hierarchical columns of input.

Raises:

Raise Any kind of error, and after catching that error it will log that error and terminate.

heliolib.feature_engineering_service.test_expected_degradation_of_the_plant module

heliolib.feature_engineering_service.test_expected_degradation_of_the_plant.create_object_of_expected_parameters_generator_with_invalid_system_age()[source]

Create an instance of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class.

This function fetches valid array info and plant table dataframes using the TestCreatingTheMockData.fetching_array_info_and_plant_table_valid_dataframe() function. It also fetches valid inverter and meteo dataframes using the TestCreatingTheMockData.fetching_inverter_and_meteo_valid_dataframe() function. Then it creates an instance of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class with the fetched data, but sets the system age as a string instead of an integer. Finally, it returns the created object.

Returns:

expected_objectExpectedParametersGenerator

An instance of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class.

heliolib.feature_engineering_service.test_expected_degradation_of_the_plant.create_object_of_expected_parameters_generator_with_valid_system_age()[source]

Create an instance of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class.

This function fetches valid array info and plant table dataframes using the TestCreatingTheMockData.fetching_array_info_and_plant_table_valid_dataframe() function. It also fetches valid inverter and meteo dataframes using the TestCreatingTheMockData.fetching_inverter_and_meteo_valid_dataframe() function. Then it creates an instance of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class with the fetched data and returns the created object.

Returns:

expected_objectExpectedParametersGenerator

An instance of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class.

heliolib.feature_engineering_service.test_expected_degradation_of_the_plant.test_expected_degradation_of_the_plant_invalid()[source]

Test the expected degradation of the plant when the system age is invalid.

This test function generates an object with expected parameters using the create_object_of_expected_parameters_generator_with_invalid_system_age() function. Then it tests whether calling the __expected_degradation() method on the object raises a TypeError with the expected error message.

Returns:

None

heliolib.feature_engineering_service.test_expected_degradation_of_the_plant.test_expected_degradation_of_the_plant_valid()[source]

Test the expected degradation of the plant when the system age is valid.

This test function creates an object of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class using the create_object_of_expected_parameters_generator_with_valid_system_age() function. It then calls the __expected_degradation() method on the object and checks if the output is an instance of pd.Series.

Returns:

None
